definition[0]: a cloth bag filled with soft material that you put on a chair or the floor to make it more comfortable
definition[1]: something that stops one thing from hitting another thing
example[2]: Good sports shoes should provide a cushion when running.
definition[2]: something, especially money, that prevents you from being immediately affected by a bad situation
example[3]: Savings can act as a cushion against unemployment.
definition[3]: the soft rubber edge of the table used for playing billiards or snooker
definition[4]: to make the effect of a fall or hit less painful, for example by having something soft in the way
example[4]: His landing was cushioned by the fresh snow that had fallen.
definition[5]: to protect someone from an unpleasant situation or the unpleasant effects of something
example[5]: generous leaving allowances to help cushion the blow of redundancy
example[6]: Many parents try to cushion their children from the outside world.
